channel.title: Selling Software - Question not advertisement
channel.description: Is there a location on these forums to sell software and the likes? Thanks in advanced.

item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:26, topic:522791”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=641286.msg4321444#msg4321444 date=1372266036][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=641286.msg4321440#msg4321440 date=1372265948]
They just capped my speed, said it was for a month. Two months later it was still capped and they denied ever capping it. When I said that I’d have to change to a different ISP, my internet magically sped up again.
[/quote]consider yourself lucky
[/quote]
Why?[/quote]because they would had been in the right to just deny you service/fine you

[quote=“Jmood, post:27, topic:522791”]All this fighting over people downloading something another person bought and or stole?

Can’t we all just be friends?[/quote]party pooper

item.title: Selling Software - Question not advertisement
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:23, topic:522791”]Some ISPs do in fact take action against piracy. If you get caught, your internet will be locked until you call up your ISP. If you continue to download illegal material, they will make you pay a fine, etc. All ISPs have different ways of handling piracy. I know for some connections such as ones provided by Verizon (not wireless, though), they will cap your bandwidth, and if you keep pirating, they will force you to watch videos about how pirating is bad.

I am unsure if this is actually happening yet, but it’s definitely coming soon.[/quote]been happening already for well over a year

[hr]

[quote=“Ambokile, post:24, topic:522791”]They just capped my speed, said it was for a month. Two months later it was still capped and they denied ever capping it. When I said that I’d have to change to a different ISP, my internet magically sped up again.[/quote]consider yourself lucky

Read full topic

item.description:

They just capped my speed, said it was for a month. Two months later it was still capped and they denied ever capping it. When I said that I’d have to change to a different ISP, my internet magically sped up again.

item.title: Selling Software - Question not advertisement
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

Some ISPs do in fact take action against piracy. If you get caught, your internet will be locked until you call up your ISP. If you continue to download illegal material, they will make you pay a fine, etc. All ISPs have different ways of handling piracy. I know for some connections such as ones provided by Verizon (not wireless, though), they will cap your bandwidth, and if you keep pirating, they will force you to watch videos about how pirating is bad.

I am unsure if this is actually happening yet, but it’s definitely coming soon.

Read full topic

item.title: Selling Software - Question not advertisement
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“ggallin, post:21, topic:522791”]1. i never said anything about jail
2. it’s plain stupid
3. not all pirated software has a virus, the majority that do are cracked windows operating systems.
/thread.
Edit: Getting caught depends on your bandwidth usage, if you encrypt your traffic, and if you buy from a good provider. I know a fella from who got caught up in a piracy ordeal and had to pay $2,500 in fines and if he ever gets caught doing it again he faces jail time.[/quote]

I don’t know how things work in UK because I’m with Virgin Media and I’ve still been torrenting around 60gb worth of videos/software etc a month or so. Most/all(?) pirating websites are blocked but I’ve been using a proxy to grab magnet links and not once has my ISP said anything? It seems more of a US thing where they actually take action depending on bandwidth usage (from what I’ve seen anyway) I could be wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Selling Software - Question not advertisement
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:17, topic:522791”][quote author=Travas link=topic=641286.msg4320734#msg4320734 date=1372185197]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=641286.msg4320715#msg4320715 date=1372183448]

[quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=641286.msg4320705#msg4320705 date=1372182593]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=641286.msg4320658#msg4320658 date=1372178206]
that still doesn’t mean that one person can’t just happen to be you
[/quote]Exactly why you shouldn’t risk going outside, driving in cars or flying in planes.
[/quote]I have been severely sun burned(with puss coming out of the blisters…), I have been in several wrecks, and I do know somebody who was in one of the few plane crashes…so really your statement is void.
[/quote]yeah I just got a sun burn last week that means I’m going to get a lawsuit filed against me for torrenting
[/quote]I never said it would, you was the person who tried to play “going outside is dangerous” card which isn’t even relevant to criminal charges. [/quote]I do not recall making that assumption. If you’re referring to RSCShadow, then yes. RSCShadow is trying to say that you have a better chance to do those things than to get a lawsuit against you for pirating, which like you said isn’t relevant to criminal charges itself, but that wasn’t the intent in the first place.

item.title: Selling Software - Question not advertisement
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:9, topic:522791”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=641286.msg4320629#msg4320629 date=1372175295]

[quote author=ggallin link=topic=641286.msg4320625#msg4320625 date=1372175112]

[quote author=TinyScape link=topic=641286.msg4320536#msg4320536 date=1372167692]

piratebay
[/quote]

pirating software is stupid and over-rated. Almost all of it is unstable and laced with worms, trojans, keyloggers, ect… Piracy may not hurt anyone, and im all for freedom to do so but it’s usually a really stupid idea.
[/quote]How is getting things for free without any repercussions overrated? I’ve never once gotten any malicious content from a pirated program.
[/quote]aww how cute you think being a pirate can’t land you in jail[/quote]This isn’t for software piracy but it’s still pretty relevant.

Assuming you shared music online for all five years of the RIAA’s legal hunt, among an (eventual) crowd of 45.6 million, that’s a one in 1,629 chance of getting caught during that time period. If we convert that to the one-year odds so frequently cited for freak accidents, you’re looking at a one in 8,129 chance, in any given year. You’re more likely to be killed in an accidental injury within the same year (a one-in-2,517 roll of the dice every time you put another candle in the cake) than face an RIAA lawsuit.
Digital Trends – 23 Oct 09

Music, Movie and Software Piracy: What’s Your Chance of Getting Caught?

Forget morals. We crunch the numbers and figure out the odds on your chances of getting snagged for piracy.

Read full topic
